div.p: I fell into it that’s the funny thing about it because when I was 18 I was working in Gloucester as a Civil Servant believe it or not and didn’t like it
and one day I was walking through Gloucester and it is quite true that I walked into the Job Centre and they were looking for security staff
in London and I thought I’d give it a go so I applied for a job, got a job and then moved to London and learnt my trade for 18 years before
coming back to Gloucester. It was something that I felt that I was good at and I think it was the first time for a long time that I felt
really good. It’s a type of communication role because that’s what security is about it’s about communicating and working on a
shopping centre in Shepherd’s Bush you know communicating with the general public every day helping people, you know, who may have
lost a child or it may be somebody wants directions or sometimes getting involved with people that, you know, were doing things
they shouldn’t have been doing like shoplifting, that sort of stuff, and I quite liked that type of role.
